Package com.shouldis.bitset.random

Class Random

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.random.Random
Direct Known Subclasses:
DensityRandom
public class Random
extends java.lang.Object
Pseudo-random number generator using a modified version of the (not cryptography-secure) XORShift64 algorithm to generate uniform random numbers. This generator has a period of 264 -1.

In addition to generating random numbers, this class can be used to generate and randomize BitSets, such that each bit has equal chance of being in the live or dead state. DensityRandom can be used to generate bits efficiently with a non-uniform chance of being in the live or dead state, whereas this implementation randomizes BitSets uniformly.

Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
DensityRandom

    Internal counter to track how many bits of booleanWord have been consumed by nextBoolean().

    Magic number value used to generate and randomize seeds.
    private static java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong SEED_ENTROPY

    Internal value used to store the current state of this generator.

    Creates an instance of Random with a randomly generated seed.

    Creates an instance of Random initialized by the specified seed such that generators with the same seed produce the same sequence.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    protected static long generateSeed()
    Randomly generates a seed using SEED_ENTROPY and the System.nanoTime().
    long getSeed()
    Returns the current seed of this Random, the seed needed to set an instance of Random to the current state of this Random through the setSeed(long) method.
    BitSet nextBitSet​(int size)
    Generates a BitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextWord().
    boolean nextBoolean()
    Returns the next pseudo-random boolean from this random number generator's sequence.

    Generates a ConcurrentBitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextWord().
    double nextDouble()
    Returns the next pseudo-random double from this random number generator's sequence, with values ranging from 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
    float nextFloat()
    Returns the next pseudo-random float from this random number generator's sequence, with values ranging from 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
    InlineBitSet nextInlineBitSet​(int size)
    Generates a InlineBitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextWord().
    int nextInt()
    Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence.
    long nextLong()
    Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence using the XOrShift64 algorithm.
    int nextPositiveInt()
    Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence shifted to ensure its always positive.
    long nextPositiveLong()
    Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence, but shifted to ensure it is always positive.
    long nextWord()
    Returns the next pseudo-random long from this random number generator's sequence.

    Changes the state of all bits in the specified BitSet set randomly according to the density of this Random.

    Performs an XOR operation on all bits in the specified range [from, to) against random bits generated by this Random.

  • Field Details

    • MAGIC_NUMBER

      private static final long MAGIC_NUMBER
      Magic number value used to generate and randomize seeds.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SEED_ENTROPY

      private static final java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong SEED_ENTROPY
      Atomic value used to ensure that seeds generated at similar times are different. This value is changed each time a seed is generated and consumed.

    • booleanWord

      private long booleanWord
      The field of bits used by nextBoolean() to more efficiently produce boolean values derived from a single bit. Initialized and refreshed with nextWord() after all bits have been consumed.

    • bitsConsumed

      private int bitsConsumed
      Internal counter to track how many bits of booleanWord have been consumed by nextBoolean().

    • state

      private long state
      Internal value used to store the current state of this generator.

  • Constructor Details

    • Random

      public Random​(long seed)
      Creates an instance of Random initialized by the specified seed such that generators with the same seed produce the same sequence. The effect of this is described by setSeed(long).
      Parameters:
      seed - the value used to initialize the state of this generator.

    • Random

      public Random()
      Creates an instance of Random with a randomly generated seed. This seed will be drawn from the current value of MAGIC_NUMBER and System.nanoTime().

  • Method Details

    • nextLong

      public final long nextLong()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence using the XOrShift64 algorithm.
      Returns:
      the next randomly generated long in the sequence.

    • nextWord

      public long nextWord()
      Returns the next pseudo-random long from this random number generator's sequence. Values returned are not meant to represent numerical values, and instead represent a field of bits.
      Returns:
      a randomly generated long word.

    • nextPositiveLong

      public final long nextPositiveLong()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence, but shifted to ensure it is always positive.
      Returns:
      the next randomly generated long.

    • nextInt

      public final int nextInt()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence.
      Returns:
      the next randomly generated integer.

    • nextPositiveInt

      public final int nextPositiveInt()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence shifted to ensure its always positive.
      Returns:
      the next randomly generated integer.

    • nextBoolean

      public final boolean nextBoolean()
      Returns the next pseudo-random boolean from this random number generator's sequence. Boolean values returned will be generated by nextWord().
      Returns:
      a randomly generated boolean.

    • nextDouble

      public final double nextDouble()
      Returns the next pseudo-random double from this random number generator's sequence, with values ranging from 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
      Returns:
      a randomly generated float.

    • nextFloat

      public final float nextFloat()
      Returns the next pseudo-random float from this random number generator's sequence, with values ranging from 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
      Returns:
      a randomly generated float.

    • nextBitSet

      public final BitSet nextBitSet​(int size)
      Generates a BitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextWord().
      Parameters:
      size - the size of generated BitSet.
      Returns:
      a randomly generated BitSet with the specified size.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is less than 0.

    • nextConcurrentBitSet

      public final ConcurrentBitSet nextConcurrentBitSet​(int size)
      Generates a ConcurrentBitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextWord().
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the generated ConcurrentBitSet.
      Returns:
      a randomly generated ConcurrentBitSet with the specified size.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is less than 0.

    • nextInlineBitSet

      public final InlineBitSet nextInlineBitSet​(int size)
      Generates a InlineBitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextWord().
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the generated InlineBitSet.
      Returns:
      a randomly generated InlineBitSet with the specified size.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is less than 0.

    • randomize

      public final void randomize​(BitSet set, int from, int to)
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range [from, to) within the specified BitSet set randomly according to the density of this Random. In contrast to xOrRandomize(BitSet) and xOrRandomize(BitSet, int, int), this method preserves that density. When using a uniformly distributed Random (as opposed to DensityRandom), this is unnecessary. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to randomize.
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be randomized.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be randomized.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range 0 to BitSet.size.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • randomize

      public final void randomize​(BitSet set)
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified BitSet set randomly according to the density of this Random. In contrast to xOrRandomize(BitSet) and xOrRandomize(BitSet, int, int), this method preserves that density. When using a uniformly distributed Random (as opposed to DensityRandom), this is unnecessary.
      Parameters:
      set - the instance of BitSet to randomize.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • xOrRandomize

      public final void xOrRandomize​(BitSet set, int from, int to)
      Performs an XOR operation on all bits in the specified range [from, to) against random bits generated by this Random. When using a non-uniformly distributed Random, namely DensityRandom, the resulting density of the BitSet set can be estimated with the function:
      density(a) + density(b) - (2 * density(a) * density(b))
      No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Parameters:
      set - the instance of BitSet to randomize.
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be randomized.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be randomized.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if from or to are outside of the range 0 to BitSet.size.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • xOrRandomize

      public final void xOrRandomize​(BitSet set)
      Performs an XOR operation on all bits against random bits in the specified BitSet set. When using a non-uniformly distributed Random, namely DensityRandom, the resulting density of this BitSet can be estimated with the function:
      density(a) + density(b) - (2 * density(a) * density(b))
      Parameters:
      set - the instance of BitSet to randomize.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if set is null.
      See Also:
      DensityRandom

    • setSeed

      public final void setSeed​(long seed)
      Changes the seed of this random number generator. If the specified seed is 0, then a random seed with be generated and used instead.
      Parameters:
      seed - the seed used to change to state of this Random.

    • getSeed

      public final long getSeed()
      Returns the current seed of this Random, the seed needed to set an instance of Random to the current state of this Random through the setSeed(long) method.
      Returns:
      the current seed, derived from the current state.

    • generateSeed

      protected static final long generateSeed()
      Randomly generates a seed using SEED_ENTROPY and the System.nanoTime().
      Returns:
      a randomly generated seed.
